title: New footage reveals moment that sparked Liverpool and Leicester's brawl with Robertson and Perez
text:
New footage has shown what sparked the huge bust-up at Anfield as Liverpool defeated Leicester, with players from both sides clashing following a penalty kick winner in the dying moments.

At the centre of the action was Reds full-back Andrew Robertson and Leicester forward Ayoze Perez, who had entered the match as a late substitute.

Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers had said after the fiery encounter that his Spanish striker had been left livid by a push from Liverpool's Scottish star, yet footage has now revealed an altercation between the duo which saw Robertson nudge an elbow into the midriff of his opponent.

Scroll down for video

Footage has shown how Andy Robertson dug a little elbow into the midriff of Ayoze Perez

The Spanish striker was immediately incensed and turned on Robertson as he walked away

Perez launched a shove into Robertson's back while the Liverpool man was walking away

Vice-captain James Milner and Virgil van Dijk immediately tried to calm the pair's scuffle

What was Perez playing at shoving Robertson in the back? 😠 pic.twitter.com/R88aE9wpZB — SNM (@JackCook95) October 6, 2019

Both players had been embroiled in a battle during the latter stages of the tie, as the two sides sides fought to earn a winner.

It is believed something was said to Robertson by Perez once the Foxes equalised on the 80th minute, courtesy of playmaker James Maddison.

Returning the favour in kind, Robertson's light dig into the Spaniard at the final whistle was then the catalyst of the unsavoury scenes.

Perez launched a powerful shove into the back of Robertson, which made the Scotland captain jolt forward.

Milner tried to reason with the forward while Adam Lallana (right) had less patience with Perez

Players from both sides flocked in to stop the ugly scenes boiling over even more at the end

Youri Tielemans sought to remove Perez from the conflict but the forward got more angered

Midfielder Adam Lallana immediately rushed to the defence of his team-mate, returning the gesture while grabbing Perez by the shirt.

Liverpool vice captain James Milner attempted to diffuse the situation along with skipper Jordan Henderson and Virgil van Dijk, while Youri Tielemans tried to remove Perez from the conflict.

The former Newcastle man, who quickly lost his head, was seen straining against his team-mates to get back at Robertson and continue the heated argument.

Neither player was booked by the referee.

When asked about the incident and Liverpool's late penalty in his post-match press conference, Rodgers said: 'According to the guys, Andy Robertson celebrated and pushed him at the final whistle which he probably didn’t expect.

Milner displayed nerves of steel in added time to slot home a penalty with the final kick

Euphoric scenes followed as Liverpool continued their 100 per cent winning run this season

'He was obviously annoyed at that and it leads to a melee. But it was nothing.'

The spot kick, scored by Milner with all-but the last touch of the match, was also disputed by the former Liverpool boss.

'To concede a 95th minute penalty was difficult to take,' said Rodgers. 'We probably deserved a point from the game. We showed our qualities to come from a goal behind.

'We looked like we could go on and win the game. I thought it was a very soft penalty, certainly not clear and obvious.'
description: New footage has shown what sparked the huge bust-up at Anfield as Liverpool beat Leicester City, with players from both sides clashing following a penalty kick winner in the dying moments.
